unnormalised: The Finance Ministry just dropped the latest economic survey, and it's got some interesting figures! India's GDP is projected to grow at 7% for FY24-25. Apparently, that's pretty good compared to other global economies. Exports saw a bump of 12.5% in Q3, which is cool. The fiscal deficit target is set at 5.1% of GDP, a slight improvement from last yearâ€™s 5.8.
normalised: The Finance Ministry just dropped the latest economic survey, and it has got some interesting figures! India's G-D-P is projected to grow at seven percent for F-Y-twenty twenty four to twenty five. Apparently, that is pretty good compared to other global economies. Exports saw a bump of twelve point five percent in Q-three, which is cool. The fiscal deficit target is set at five point one percent of G-D-P, a slight improvement from last year's five point eight.

unnormalised: Inflation is still a bit of a worry, hovering around 5.5%, but the RBI is expected to keep a close watch. FDI inflows remained steady at $45 billion. Some analysts think that could have been higher, considering the investment climate. But hey, not bad, right? Plus, the budget allocated Rs. 10 lakh crore for infrastructure development.
normalised: Inflation is still a bit of a worry, hovering around five point five percent, but the R-B-I is expected to keep a close watch. F-D-I inflows remained steady at forty five billion dollars. Some analysts think that could have been higher, considering the investment climate. But hey, not bad, right? Plus, the budget allocated rupees ten lakh crore for infrastructure development.

unnormalised: Overall, the report paints a fairly positive picture. Challenges remain, sure, but the Indian economy seems to be holding its own. Let's see if the optimism holds up throughout the year, eh? Will keep you updated!
normalised: Overall, the report paints a fairly positive picture. Challenges remain, sure, but the Indian economy seems to be holding its own. Let's see if the optimism holds up throughout the year, eh? Will keep you updated!
